title: Crispy Shrimp Pasta With Arugula Pesto Cream Sauce
summary: Crispy Shrimp Pasta With Arugula Pesto Cream Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 2 and costs $5.63 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 86g of protein, 31g of fat, and a total of 1517 calories. A couple people made this recipe, and 41 would say it hit the spot. If you have it had been far too long since i made a batch, salt, fettuccine, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 4 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 89%, this dish is super. Similar recipes are Shrimp Pasta with Arugulan and Walnut Pesto, Shrimp Pasta with Arugulan and Walnut Pesto, and Arugula Walnut Pesto Pasta with Shrimp.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
